intro: Diplostephium antisanense, commonly known as the Antisanense spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed soils or open areas. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
